title.value: Application of AI in community based primary health care: Systematic Review and critical appraisal
title.justification: The title is provided clearly in the document.
title.quote:
Title
Application of AI in community based primary health care: Systematic Review and
critical appraisal

extractions.description: This paper conducts a systematic scoping review to identify and evaluate studies that have tested and/or implemented AI in community-based primary health care (CBPHC), focusing on various AI interventions like machine learning, natural language processing, and expert systems.

type.justification: The paper conducts a systematic scoping review to identify and evaluate existing studies, which is empirical research.
type.quote: Objective: Identify and evaluate studies that have tested and/or implemented AI in CBPHC. Study design: We conduced a a systematic scoping review...

name.justification: The research field is primarily focused on the application of AI within community-based primary health care, a domain within healthcare.
name.quote: we know little about the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) into community based primary health care (CBPHC).

name.justification: Machine learning is explicitly mentioned as one of the most highly studied AI interventions in CBPHC in the paper.
name.quote: Machine learning (46%), natural language processing (NLP) (27%) and expert systems (19%) were the most highly AI interventions studied in CBPHC.

name.justification: Natural language processing (NLP) is highlighted as one of the main AI interventions studied in the paper.
name.quote: Machine learning (46%), natural language processing (NLP) (27%) and expert systems (19%) were the most highly AI interventions studied in CBPHC.

name.justification: Expert systems are mentioned as a major AI intervention studied in the context of CBPHC.
name.quote: Machine learning (46%), natural language processing (NLP) (27%) and expert systems (19%) were the most highly AI interventions studied in CBPHC.

name.justification: Neural networks are mentioned specifically as having the highest accuracy for the given clinical tasks within the studies reviewed.
name.quote: Highest accuracy was reported for neural networks, considering the given database for the given clinical task.

is_contributed.justification: The neural networks model is mentioned as part of the survey of existing studies, not as a contribution of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Highest accuracy was reported for neural networks, considering the given database for the given clinical task.

is_executed.justification: The paper is a systematic review and does not execute any model itself. It discusses the findings from other studies.
is_executed.quote: we know little about the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) into community based primary health care (CBPHC).

is_compared.justification: Neural networks are discussed in terms of their accuracy in comparison to other models or approaches, as part of the review findings.
is_compared.quote: Highest accuracy was reported for neural networks, considering the given database for the given clinical task.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The systematic review aggregates multiple papers and doesn't specifically reference one paper for the neural networks' contribution.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Machine learning (46%), natural language processing (NLP) (27%) and expert systems (19%) were the most highly AI interventions studied in CBPHC.
